## Welcome {#welcome}

This is a template website that you can use for your own stuff! Hopefully this is easy to edit and adapt for anything you would like

## About

Dustin Haraden is a psychology professor and has a focus on transparency and equity when it comes to science and technology. Use this site however you can to increase your outreach! This is a template from [Openscapes](https://openscapes.org).

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(rio)
library(here)
library(tinytable)
library(gt)
library(gtExtras)
library(dplyr)

board <- import(here("data", "psyc101XP.xlsx")) %>% 
  arrange(desc(XP))

#https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/tinytable/vignettes/plot.html
#xp_list <- as.list(board$XP)
#
#board %>% 
#  mutate("Bar" = "") %>% 
#  arrange(desc(XP)) %>% 
#  tt() %>% 
#  plot_tt(j=4, fun = "bar", data = xp_list, color = "orange")


#https://jthomasmock.github.io/gtExtras/articles/plotting-with-gtExtras.html


arranged_board <- board %>% 
  arrange(desc(XP)) %>% 
  mutate("Character XP" = 175, 
         Rank = dense_rank(desc(XP)),
         Class = as.factor(Class)) %>% 
  relocate(Rank)

arranged_board %>% 
  gt() %>%
  #gt_plt_bar(column = XP, keep_column = TRUE, width = 35) 
    gt_plt_bullet(column = "Character XP", target = XP, width = 45,
               palette = c("magenta", "black")) %>%
  gt_color_rows(
     Rank, 
     pal_type = "discrete", 
     palette = c("green", "white", "blue")) %>% 
  gt_badge(Class, 
           palette = c(
             "Behavioral Bard"="darkblue",
             "Social Rogue"="firebrick4",
             "Dreamweaver Druid"="cornflowerblue",
             "Neuroknight"="magenta",
             "Cognitive Wizard"="darkgrey",
             "Learning Monk"="tan3",
             "Sensation Sorcerer"="seagreen1",
             "Psych Mage"="tomato3",
             "Personality Paladin"="green",
             "Miss. Ing"="gainsboro")) %>% 
  tab_header(
    title = md("**PSYC 101 - XP Rankings**")) %>% 
  cols_label(
    Rank = md("**Rank**"), 
    "Character Name" = md("**Character Name**"),
    Class = md("**CLass**"), 
    "Character XP" = md("**Character XP**")
  )


  


```
